results.title: Cook's Family Farm
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the Cook family and spend time with three generations as they muster and milk cows. Robert and Patricia are the proud parents of five grown up sons and 22 grandchildren. Brothers, Ross and Steve Cook have returned to share-farm with their mum and dad and there is no other place they would rather be. Surrounded by rolling hills and the winery county of the King Valley in northern Victoria, the Cook family have worked hard to keep and grow their dairy farm.

results.title: Adolescence: perspective

group_works.title: Joe and Roxy
group_works.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Joe and Roxy
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Adolescence: perspective”.
The second of three dramas on adolescence, this film deals with teenagers in love. Joe and Roxy, at fifteen and sixteen respectively, face more than the usual number of teen-age problems. Roxy, the product of a broken home, tries to keep her romantic illusions alive against her mother’s worry and disappointment in life. Joe turns unsuccessfully to his father, a man of narrow mind and dull sensibilities, to help him decide his future. In their story the film contrasts the teenagers’ need for absolute rules with the confusion of adult standards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Music is Sweet
results.brief_description: Share the joy of music with these amazing young voices from Poowong Consolidated School. Meet the kids and teachers of this inspirational primary school where writing, recording and performing songs is taught hand-in-hand with all the other standard subjects. Students of all grades are given the opportunity to express themselves through music and to perform their songs infront of their peers and the community.

results.title: The Pizzini Family
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a story about an Italian-Australian family made unique by three generations of winemakers and master chefs. Meet Natalie, Alfred, Arnold, Katrina, Carla and matriarch Rosetta Pizzini, hear about the four brothers that immigrated to Australia and started farming tobacco, eventually diversifying to growing Italian variety grapes. The Pizzini’s make their own wine, run a cooking school and manage a boutique hotel in Whitfield, but still the most important part of their day is when they sit together and share a meal, a glass of wine and a laugh.

results.title: The Goddess and the poet
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Roberto Salvatore and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet Christos Raskatos, old fashioned romantic. Meet him as a poet who has a love affair with words, as a local in love with Lorne and as a guy who catches a crayfish now and then in paradise. Interview taken at Lorne Fisheries, Lorne Pier.

results.title: Meeniyan Junior CFA
results.brief_description: The next generation of fire fighters start young. In an effort to encourage the young people of Meeniyan to become senior CFA members, the Meeniyan Junior CFA creates an atmosphere of fun and friendship while teaching kids the basics of fire fighting.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Wangaratta
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: This program contains nine stories about residents from around the Wangaratta region in north-eastern Victoria. Covering the towns of Eldorado, King Valley, Greta, Whitfield and Whitlands, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.
